content:
I realized that since all of our documentation is on a Wiki, we can't use pull requests to discuss proposed changes. In our current situation, we can link the Wiki commits on each issue to track changes.

At some point (soon?) we should create the docuementation as Markdown content in the cds-hooks repository so we can work with PRs track changes/issues better.

Perhaps we leave the current Wiki documentation as-is for an archive until the new Markdown cds-hook repository content is solidified and the community is ready? (Hopefully in time for the May Connectathon?)
Agreed we should transition to a regular repo-backed docs site. Or I suppose we could try something funny and clone the wiki to a separate repo and use that for PRs,
I'm looking at some OSS options for documentation layouts using Markdown
